# sonatyperepo_capability_ui_settings (Resource)

Manage Capability: UI Settings
		
**NOTE:** Requires Sonatype Nexus Repostiory 3.84.0 or later.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "sonatyperepo_capability_ui_settings" "cap" {
  enabled      = true
  last_updated = "Thursday, 06-Nov-25 14:11:02 GMT"
  notes        = "Automatically added on Wed Oct 16 12:27:43 GMT 2024"
  properties = {
    debug_allowed                 = true
    long_request_timeout          = 180
    request_timeout               = 60
    session_timeout               = 30
    status_interval_anonymous     = 60
    status_interval_authenticated = 5
    title                         = "Sonatype Nexus Repository"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `enabled` (Boolean) Whether the Capability is enabled.
- `properties` (Attributes) Properties specific to this Capability type (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--properties))

### Optional

- `notes` (String) Optional notes about configured capability.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The internal ID of the Capability.
- `last_updated` (String)

<a id="nestedatt--properties"></a>
### Nested Schema for `properties`

Optional:

- `debug_allowed` (Boolean) Allow developer debugging.
- `long_request_timeout` (Number) Period of time to keep the connection alive for requests expected to take an extended period of time (seconds).
- `request_timeout` (Number) Period of time to keep the connection alive for requests expected to take a normal period of time (seconds).
- `session_timeout` (Number) Period of inactivity before session times out (minutes). A value of 0 will mean that a session never expires.
- `status_interval_anonymous` (Number) Interval between status requests for anonymous user (seconds).
- `status_interval_authenticated` (Number) Interval between status requests for authenticated users (seconds).
- `title` (String) Browser page title.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import an existing UI Settings Capability into Terraform State.
#
# NOTE: The CAPABILITY_ID can be obtained from the datasource.

# Example
terraform import sonatyperepo_capability_ui_settings.cap CAPABILITY_ID
```
